messages.content:
symptoms:Fever, cough, sore throat
Diagnosis:
Common cold or flu. Rest and stay hydrated.

symptoms:Chest pain, shortness of breath, sweating
Diagnosis:
Possible heart attack. Seek immediate medical attention.

symptoms:Severe headache, sensitivity to light, nausea
Diagnosis:
Possible migraine or tension headache. Rest in a dark, quiet room.

symptoms:Abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea
Diagnosis:
Possible gastroenteritis. Drink fluids and rest.

symptoms:Frequent urination, increased thirst, unexplained weight loss
Diagnosis:
Possible diabetes. Consult a healthcare provider.

symptoms:Joint pain, swelling, stiffness
Diagnosis:
Possible arthritis. Consult a physician for proper management.

symptoms:Itchy eyes, runny nose, sneezing
Diagnosis:
Allergic rhinitis (hay fever). Antihistamines may help.

symptoms:Rash, fever, fatigue
Diagnosis:
Possible viral infection or allergic reaction. Consult a doctor.

symptoms:Sudden weight gain, swelling in legs, fatigue
Diagnosis:
Possible heart failure. Immediate medical evaluation needed.

symptoms:Persistent cough, blood in sputum, weight loss
Diagnosis:
Possible tuberculosis or lung cancer. Seek urgent medical care.

symptoms:Blurred vision, eye pain, redness
Diagnosis:
Possible glaucoma or eye infection. Consult an ophthalmologist.

symptoms:Memory loss, confusion, difficulty concentrating
Diagnosis:
Possible dementia or Alzheimer's disease. Neurological assessment needed.

symptoms:Fatigue, pale skin, dizziness
Diagnosis:
Possible anemia. Blood tests and treatment advised.

symptoms:High fever, neck stiffness, confusion
Diagnosis:
Possible meningitis. Immediate medical attention required.

symptoms:Sudden weakness on one side, slurred speech, facial droop
Diagnosis:
Possible stroke. Call emergency services immediately.

symptoms:Severe abdominal pain, blood in stool
Diagnosis:
Possible gastrointestinal bleeding. Urgent medical care required.

symptoms:Thirst, excessive hunger, frequent urination
Diagnosis:
Possible diabetes mellitus. Consult a healthcare provider.

symptoms:Weight loss, night sweats, persistent cough
Diagnosis:
Possible tuberculosis or lung cancer. Seek urgent evaluation.

symptoms:Frequent headaches, blurred vision, fatigue
Diagnosis:
Possible hypertension (high blood pressure). Regular monitoring and lifestyle changes recommended.

symptoms:Severe lower back pain, difficulty urinating
Diagnosis:
Possible kidney stones or urinary tract infection. Medical consultation needed.
